identificationModule.briefTitle: Montelukast Compared With Placebo and Salmeterol in Exercise-Induced Bronchoconstriction (0476-316)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Double-Blind, Randomized Multicenter, 3-Period, Crossover Study to Evaluate the Effects of a Single Dose of Montelukast Compared With Placebo and Salmeterol on Exercise-Induced Bronchoconstriction

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To determine the effect of an approved medication being studied in support of a new approach in the prevention of exercise-induced asthma (a worsening of asthma caused by exercise, also known as exercise-induced bronchospasm), in patients who have a history of worsening asthma after exercise.

interventions.name: Comparator: Montelukast
interventions.description: 1 dose montelukast 10 mg tablet given orally in one of three treatment periods

interventions.name: Comparator: Salmeterol
interventions.description: 1 dose of 50 ug salmeterol given by inhalation in one of three treatment periods

interventions.name: Comparator: Placebo (montelukast)
interventions.description: 1 dose matching-image placebo to montelukast tablet in two of three treatment periods

interventions.name: Comparator: Placebo (salmeterol)
interventions.description: 1 dose matching-image placebo of salmeterol 50 ug inhalation in two of three treatment periods

primaryOutcomes.measure: Maximum Percent Fall in Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) After Exercise Challenge at 2 Hours Post-dose in Patients With Exercise-Induced Bronchoconstriction (EIB)
primaryOutcomes.description: In patients with EIB, the percent change from pre-exercise baseline FEV1 to the lowest FEV1 within 60 minutes after exercise challenge (2 hours post-dose). The FEV1 measurement obtained 5 minutes before the exercise challenge was the baseline, and was specific to each exercise challenge.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 0-60 minutes after the exercise challenge performed 2 hours after a single oral dose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Patients Requiring β-Agonist Rescue Medication After Exercise Challenge at 2 Hours Postdose
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 0-90 minutes after the exercise challenge performed at 2 hours postdose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Patients Requiring β-Agonist Rescue Medication After Exercise Challenge at 8.5 Hours Postdose
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 0-90 minutes after the exercise challenge performed at 8.5 hours postdose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Patients Requiring β-Agonist Rescue Medication After Exercise Challenge at 24 Hours Postdose
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 0-90 minutes after the exercise challenge performed at 24 hours postdose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Maximum Percent Fall in FEV1 After Exercise Challenge at 8.5 Hours Post-dose in Patients With EIB
secondaryOutcomes.description: In patients with EIB, the percent change from pre-exercise baseline FEV, to the lowest FEV1 within 60 minutes after exercise challenge (8.5 hours post-dose). The FEV1 measurement obtained 5 minutes before the exercise challenge was the baseline, and was specific to each exercise challenge.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 0-60 minutes after the exercise challenge performed 8.5 hours after a single oral dose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Maximum Percent Fall in FEV1 After Exercise Challenge at 24 Hours Post-dose in Patients With EIB
secondaryOutcomes.description: In patients with EIB, the percent change from pre-exercise baseline FEV, to the lowest FEV1 within 60 minutes after exercise challenge (24 hours post-dose). The FEV1 measurement obtained 5 minutes before the exercise challenge was the baseline, and was specific to each exercise challenge.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 0-60 minutes after the exercise challenge performed 24 hours after a single oral dose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Area Under the Curve for FEV1 Percent Change From Preexercise Baseline During the 60 Minutes Following Exercise Challenge (AUC 0-60 Min) at 2 Hours Postdose
secondaryOutcomes.description:
The measure included only the area below the pre-exercise

baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 0-60 minutes after the exercise challenge at 2 hours postdose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Area Under the Curve for FEV1 Percent Change From Preexercise Baseline During the 60 Minutes Following Exercise Challenge (AUC 0-60 Min) at 8.5 Hours Postdose
secondaryOutcomes.description: The measure included only the area below the pre-exercise baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 0-60 minutes after the exercise challenge at 8.5 hours postdose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Area Under the Curve for FEV1 Percent Change From Preexercise Baseline During the 60 Minutes Following Exercise Challenge (AUC 0-60 Min) at 24 Hours Postdose
secondaryOutcomes.description: The measure included only the area below the pre-exercise baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 0-60 minutes after the exercise challenge at 24 hours postdose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to Recovery From Maximum Percentage Decrease in FEV1 After Exercise Challenge at 2 Hours Postdose
secondaryOutcomes.description: The time to recovery from maximum percent fall is the duration between the time at which the maximum percent fall in FEV1 after exercise challenge occurs and the time when FEV1 returns to within 5% of the preexercise baseline for the first time.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to Recovery From Maximum Percentage Decrease in FEV1 After Exercise Challenge at 8.5 Hours Postdose
secondaryOutcomes.description:
The time to recovery from maximum percent fall is the

duration between the time at which the maximum percent fall in FEV1 after exercise challenge occurs and the

time when FEV1 returns to within 5% of the preexercise baseline for the first time.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to Recovery From Maximum Percentage Decrease in FEV1 After Exercise Challenge at 24 Hours Postdose
secondaryOutcomes.description:
The time to recovery from maximum percent fall is the

duration between the time at which the maximum percent fall in FEV1 after exercise challenge occurs and the

time when FEV1 returns to within 5% of the preexercise baseline for the first time.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Physician-diagnosed exercise-induced bronchospasm

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patient is, other than asthma, not in good, stable health. The Primary Investigator will evaluate whether there are other reasons why the patient may not participate.

references.citation: Philip G, Pearlman DS, Villaran C, Legrand C, Loeys T, Langdon RB, Reiss TF. Single-dose montelukast or salmeterol as protection against exercise-induced bronchoconstriction. Chest. 2007 Sep;132(3):875-83. doi: 10.1378/chest.07-0550. Epub 2007 Jun 15.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: Patients who required excluded medications, or did not meet FEV1 criteria during the prestudy period were excluded from randomization.
participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails:
Patients were randomized at 5 sites (4 in the US and 1 in Peru).

Primary therapy period: December 2005 to August 2006

groups.title: Montelukast/ Salmeterol/Placebo
groups.description:
During Period I (placebo run-in), all patients received a single witnessed dose of montelukast matching-image placebo oral tablet followed immediately by salmeterol matching-image placebo inhalation powder. During Period II, patients received a single witnessed dose of montelukast 10-mg oral tablet and salmeterol matching-image placebo inhalation powder.

Washout 1 (Washout between Periods II and III) 3- to 7-day washout between Periods II and III.

During Period III, patients received a single witnessed dose of montelukast matching-image placebo oral tablet followed immediately by salmeterol 50-μg inhalation powder.

Washout 2 (Washout between Periods III and IV) 3- to 7-day washout between Periods III and IV.

During Period IV, patients received a single witnessed dose of montelukast matching-image placebo oral tablet followed immediately by salmeterol matching-image placebo inhalation powder.

periods.title: Washout Between Periods II and III
Washout Between Periods III and IV

achievements.comment: 1 pt in the montelukast/placebo/salmeterol group discontinued during washout period 2 after placebo

groups.title: Overall Study Population
groups.description: All randomized patients

measures.title: Need for β-agonist rescue medication following exercise challenge
Area under the FEV1 percent change from baseline time curve for 0-60 mins after exercise challenge
Maximum percent fall in forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) post-exercise challenge
Time to recovery from maximal percent fall
measures.description: The duration between the time at which the maximum percent fall in FEV1 occurs and the time when FEV1 returns to within 5% of the preexercise baseline for the first time.

outcomeMeasures.title: Maximum Percent Fall in Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) After Exercise Challenge at 2 Hours Post-dose in Patients With Exercise-Induced Bronchoconstriction (EIB)
outcomeMeasures.description: In patients with EIB, the percent change from pre-exercise baseline FEV1 to the lowest FEV1 within 60 minutes after exercise challenge (2 hours post-dose). The FEV1 measurement obtained 5 minutes before the exercise challenge was the baseline, and was specific to each exercise challenge.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: The primary efficacy analysis used the modified intention-to-treat (MITT) approach. Patients with data from only one period were not included in the analysis.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: 0-60 minutes after the exercise challenge performed 2 hours after a single oral dose

outcomeMeasures.title: Area Under the Curve for FEV1 Percent Change From Preexercise Baseline During the 60 Minutes Following Exercise Challenge (AUC 0-60 Min) at 2 Hours Postdose
outcomeMeasures.description:
The measure included only the area below the pre-exercise

baseline
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: The secondary efficacy analysis used a MITT approach. If a patient received β-agonist rescue medication during the 60 minutes following exercise challenge, then the last pre-rescue FEV1 measurement was carried forward to 60 minutes. Patients with data from only one period were not included in the analysis.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: 0-60 minutes after the exercise challenge at 2 hours postdose

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: Periods II through IV and washout periods in between these treatment periods, and up to and including 14 days after the last dose of study therapy.
adverseEventsModule.description: Although a patient may have had two or more adverse experiences the patient is counted only once in a category. The same patient may appear in different categories.

eventGroups.title: Montelukast/ Salmeterol/Placebo
eventGroups.description:
During Period I (placebo run-in), all patients received a single witnessed dose of montelukast matching-image placebo oral tablet followed immediately by salmeterol matching-image placebo inhalation powder. During Period II, patients received a single witnessed dose of montelukast 10-mg oral tablet and salmeterol matching-image placebo inhalation powder.

Washout 1 (Washout between Periods II and III) 3- to 7-day washout between Periods II and III.

During Period III, patients received a single witnessed dose of montelukast matching-image placebo oral tablet followed immediately by salmeterol 50-μg inhalation powder.

Washout 2 (Washout between Periods III and IV) 3- to 7-day washout between Periods III and IV.

During Period IV, patients received a single witnessed dose of montelukast matching-image placebo oral tablet followed immediately by salmeterol matching-image placebo inhalation powder.

certainAgreement.otherDetails: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

pointOfContact.title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development

ancestors.term: Hormones, Hormone Substitutes, and Hormone Antagonists
